subtitle: Hello everyone, I want to recommend a book, or three books, written by my dear friend Emmanuel
he's someone that I trust a lot and has helped me a lot and has helped many since he created the
Gnostic method app. The main book I'm recommending here is called "The Beginning In The Middle" and it
is designed to be the companion study book to the Gnostic Method App - if you've not heard of this
app it is an excellent resource to help you walk this path towards the genuine awakening of your
consciousness towards your real being there's a video about it in the description below; I
recommend checking it out if you've not already. This book is a collection of essays written in a
way that is clearly from my friend's own insights and experiences throughout his own journey it is
literally a companion; a book from a supportive friend to help you understand the not so easy
to understand concepts and deeper mysteries of the Gnostic pathâ€”the Gnostic path being a very
esoteric path, not esoteric because we are trying to be fancy or mystical on purpose, but esoteric
because the depths of our consciousness is not words and theories but what is closer to the
truth is or what helps us to understand this truth better is mystical but also precise understanding
of esoteric themes, symbols, analogies, metaphors etc. it is a science, a specific esoteric science...
a person who is primarily intellectual won't understand this, about the Gnostic path being
esoteric, because it's only until one begins having deeper personal meditations, self-realizations,
astral experiences, awakening consciousness that then one begins to start perceiving the world
beyond the physical where deeper dimensions of consciousness are understood much more profoundly
through esoteric comprehension so that is why we need to study to better understand what we
are going through as we walk our path so what I'm trying to say here is that you could certainly get
this book and enjoy it, especially if you have some experience on the path already, but ideally
this book is best enjoyed while studying and practicing what is taught in the Gnostic method
app, as a lot of you know I've recommended a lot of different Gnostic resources in my videos but
the Gnostic method app along with this book is definitely one of the best especially if
you're a beginner, but also if you're experienced, to help you in a gradual and step-by-step way in
understanding the true reality depth and power of these teachings now I'm going to comment on
the other two books in a little bit briefly but just before I do I want to share just a couple
of small themes that are explored in this book the beginning in the middle the following is by
no means a description of what the whole book is about it's just a couple of points that I
personally really loved when I was reading it and also which I feel people who watch this channel
will benefit from too in a lot of these teachings we always say things like "follow your Being", "follow
your Inner Master", "follow your Intuition", but most of us don't understand this right, why? Well
my friend begins this book by addressing this and he breaks it down quite ruthlessly but also
logically that the way we perceive our world and our life and situation is just plainly incorrect
to quote - we all take ourselves to be quite normal we think the way we think the way we feel the way
we act is normal this is why it is so difficult for us to progress spiritually a powerful point
already right and he continues to talk about how no matter what we learn intellectually
whatever we build on our already abnormal foundation will fundamentally be abnormal
it will be flawed meaning whatever spiritual knowledge we are studying will not bear fruit
because we are trying to build it on a foundation that is already incorrect, abnorma,l flawed. Why?
Because we aren't changing at a fundamental level, in our foundation, in other words - the situation we
find ourselves in here and now in an unawakened state is totally dysfunctional, he describes
this dysfunction of our human machine our human psyche like this: "We make the mistake of putting
what is emotional into the area that processes intellectual information, many times we place what
is sexual into the area of the body that deals with emotions, the outcome for us is very confusing,
consider a computer that when you send an instruction to it instead of sending it to
the central processor it ignores you and sends it directly to the printer can you imagine for
a moment trying to run a business or an office and when you send an email from one computer to
another the email takes on an emotional quality that you didn't include and adds numbers that
were never sent by the original sender the business would soon fail in its operation
this is how we all live and work every day psychologically we wear our shoes on our hands
and we have glasses on our ears"... so this humorous but terrible truth of our inherent malfunction
becomes how we think and what we think we are and we end up lost in this insanity and chaos and so
the point of studying and comprehending this is crucial in order to learn what it really means to
access our real being our inner master that real part of our Consciousness that is being obscured
and controlled and covered up by this malfunction this insanity and this chaos and so it's in this
way by studying this, by gaining self-knowledge and self-comprehension on all this that we can
learn what it means to create a conscious center of gravity within ourselves or in other words a
conscious psyche within ourselves now the idea of becoming a psychologically conscious sounds
quite simple and intellectual doesn't it but actually this is a much deeper and much more of a
sacred and divine unfolding within ourselves this journey to really realize the reality of this it
is a path that is much much more magical than we initially imagined and a really great part
of this book I loved is how it describes the nature of what magic really means and more
importantly giving thanks to this Divine aspect within ourselves, because once we start making
progress on the path of awakening and start having magical experiences such as astral projection for
example it's very easy to start to think "I, me, I did this, I achieved this through my efforts"
and so comes along the ego again slowing down our learning and our sense of connection to our
inner divinity so to explain this further in short and what is explained in the book - experiences are
given to us, we don't make them, ego does not enable experiences - in fact it disables it. The problem is
we have an experience from a little state of ego and then we wake up and say "wow that was
all me, I'm amazing" so what my friend emphasizes here in a beautiful way is that we must learn
to give thanks where it's due and I don't think I can emphasize this enough either that we must
recognize these powers are from our inner divinity, our consciousness, our inner Divine Mother and
Divine Father - these superior aspects of our being... you know a lot of people always ask for techniques
for astral projection and what's the right way to do it but they just don't get this part that
is spoken about so well in this book, so I quote - "As the ego is still alive in us we hide to ourselves
the ego of self-love, we pat ourselves on our backs and say Well done we must be very good students to
have achieved this and that experience how great we must be and if we are extremely foolish we may
even begin to tell any Tom Dick or Harry about them this early stage of our inner development
is unfortunately the first stumbling block for many esoteric students we must utterly destroy
the ego of self-love and use that energy trapped inside that ego to give thanks to the elements
that really support our inner growth he who is awake without dreams with all of the ego totally
gone no longer lives in the selfish my will but is absorbed completely in thy will of the true being"...
now I'm paraphrasing a little bit here as I can't read the whole text in one video but
if this is something new to you this is already a great reason to get this book and read the whole
thing which explains this all in much more detail and just to comment on that about my very first
astral projection experience which I think is a good example I didn't use any fancy techniques
at all I simply asked, I prayed, and I received, and after I said thank you and felt grateful - it
really is that simple and it can be that simple for everyone but because we have ego and don't
understand or feel a connection to divinity we invest so much energy in egos of greed,
pride, desire for powers, and into relying on fancy intellectual techniques, instead of investing our
hearts into recognizing and giving thanks to the real power within us that really enabled our
experiences I've touched on this before but the way he explains it in this book, I can't recommend
it enough, and I definitely consider it essential reading for those who have been following this
channel since the beginning. So he continues explaining all this by pointing out something I
see all the time which is when people say things like "I tried this or that method for astral
projection or for meditation or for overcoming an ego but it didn't work so I got bored or I
left the path" or they just say "this is a waste of time, why do this?" and in the book my friend
makes the point very directly that this kind of thinking in itself IS a test and he says it like;
we're asking our inner divine mother and father for experiences and realizations and spiritual
awakening but for whatever reason we weren't given any rewards â€“ we weren't given any "sweets"
from our parents and because of that we acted like an ungrateful child towards our own divinity
and we can see this in daily life in families right - if you're a parent with a somewhat naughty
child, if you keep giving your child special treats and presents but they still behave ungratefully
then you no longer want to treat them right -- we're in a very similar situation. So this is a very
beautiful and simple teaching that experiences on the path are actually very simple to attain: all
you need to do to be successful is just purify your heart and ask God for what you want, that's
it, no fancy "Law of Attraction" techniques needed or elaborate visualizations etc just pure simple
innocent love and relationship with the Divine and walk the past in Remembering and honoring that.
That's why in the Bible it says: For it is by Grace you have been saved through Faith and this is not
from yourselves, it is the gift of God, not by 'works' so that no one can boast. Now as much as I'd love
to share more about this book I want to keep this video short and I've summarized on the screen
just some of the main points that you'll learn from this book: understanding what consciousness
really is, understanding the human machine and our conditioning, understanding why killing the ego is
so fundamental, understanding solar and lunar bodies, man as a seed and how to germinate it,
God, Unity and Sexual Alchemy as the highest form of magic, why the path is so bitter in
the beginning but becomes sweeter over time, and realizing the sense of true committed devotion
or love for the path... Now if you enjoy this book there are two other books I'm also recommending
so that's three all together the first is the red one; "The Beginning In The Middle" that we've
just been looking at - the second is the yellow one "The Truth That Is A Lie" and the blue one, "The Child
As Sage" ~ three beautiful books, The Truth That Is A Lie is also perhaps a good place to start if
you're totally new to all of this - it deals with in a direct way about totally dismantling our
conditioned ordinary state of consciousness or states of perception... to completely tear down our
never-ending ego interpretation of reality; as quoted: "This book is for the rebel, the one who
is willing to go against everything that wants to know Truth at any cost no matter what"... and
he's not wrong about all that friends because if you really want to know the truth you have
to be willing to give up everything in your life, everything, that's how much it should mean to you
because only then can you handle the conscious shocks of truth without getting burned, offended,
scared, overwhelmed, confused, upset etc and to throw everything away doesn't necessarily mean you throw
away possessions or friends or whatever but more fundamentally it means to let everything you think
and interpret of reality - die... and not just your thoughts and interpretations and ego to die but
also the memory of all that to die! To completely erase your past conditioning, your personal history,
to unlearn everything that you've learned in order to really see and feel and touch the truth.
This is why Jesus said: "Whoever wishes to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will
find it." So this is also a really powerful book I highly recommend and he goes into these kinds
of things and how to do it in a really profound way. As for The Child As Sage book this is a very
playful and poetic book teaching the simplicity and wisdom of our child within and teaches gnosis
through wonderful poems and children's stories. While intellectual study is important it is also
in art and higher and superior emotions of our Being that we can better grasp the essence or
spirit of certain teachings and that's what this book does so beautifully... so in a way, The Beginning
In The Middle book is science, The Truth That Is A Lie book is religion, and The Child as Sage book is
art; so together you have in the series science, art and religion which are all fundamental ingredients
of gnosis. So the links to purchase any of these books are in the description below, your support
towards my friend in purchasing these books and supporting the work he's doing such as
The Gnostic Method App is deeply appreciated, if you have any questions at all please leave
a comment down below and please share this video with others who you feel will enjoy these books
or benefit from them too... and with that everyone I leave you with just one of the beautiful poems
that are in The Child As Sage book... "The Quest"... To be truly free from ignorance and pain, we must
learn and grow and never wane, in our quest for knowledge and truth, that will help us uncover
our inner youth, it's not about robes or temples high, but about waking up and learning to fly, to
the heights of consciousness and true light, that will help us overcome the darkest of nights, to
gain knowledge we must sit and think, and learn to understand what makes us shrink, the cause of our
suffering deep inside, and learn to let go of our foolish pride, through meditation we can see the
moments that causes misery, and learn to let go of all the blame, to find a way to rise above the pain,
it's hard to trust our own perception for it is clouded by our own deception, but with focus
and hard work we can see, the truth that lies within you and me, so let's learn to let go of
our pride, and find the knowledge that we'll never subside, to understand ourselves and find our way,
to a life of happiness with INRI at play, so let's start by learning about ourselves and the things
that make our lives a living hell, and through knowledge we can find our way, to a life of joy
and a brighter day, the Gnostic path is one of pure science, where we seek to learn and never defiance,
to suspend judgment and see things as they are, and find the knowledge that will take us far...
